## TL; DR * AWSTerraform * terraforming ## AWS Terraform Terraform Terraform ##### 1\. v2Terraform * Pros: Terraform * Cons: ##### 2\. data resourceTerraform * Pros: 13 * Cons: ##### 3\. Terraform * Pros: * Cons: Terraformimport 3 ### terraform import 3 `terraform import` 1. `.tf` 2. `terraform import` ( `.tfstate` ) 3. `.tfstate` .tf [Terraformimport](https://blog.mosuke.tech/entry/2018/06/20/terraform_import/) ### terraforming [Forkwell ](http://tech.grooves.com/entry/2018/01/22/091959) terraformingRuby [terraforming](https://github.com/dtan4/terraforming) .tf.tfstate 1. `.tfstate` 2. `.tf` 3. `.tf` `.tfstate` 4. `.tf` `.tfstate` `terraform plan` ( `.tf` `.tfstate` ) 5. `.tfstate` 
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# terraforming_merge.sh

set -o nounset
set -o errexit

terraforming_resource_key=$1
output_filename=$2.tf

#  .tfstate
aws s3 cp s3://my-terraform-state/aws-terraform.tfstate ./bin/

# 
cp ./bin/aws-terraform.tfstate ./bin/aws-terraform.tfstate.bak

# .tf 
terraforming $terraforming_resource_key > $output_filename

# tfstate
terraforming $terraforming_resource_key --tfstate --merge ./bin/aws-terraform.tfstate --overwrite

# grep
./bin/terraform_plan.sh > result.log
is_changed=$(echo $(cat result.log | grep 'to add'))

if [ -n "$is_changed" ]; then
  # result.log
  echo "diff found. Check your changes."
else
  # import
  echo "ALL GREEN. .bak is deleted and overwrite merged tfstate to s3."
  rm ./bin/aws-terraform.tfstate.bak
  rm result.log
  # upload tfstate
  aws s3 cp ./bin/aws-terraform.tfstate s3://my-terraform-state/aws-terraform.tfstate
  rm ./bin/aws-terraform.tfstate
fi
`$ terraforming_merge.sh vpc my-vpc` import () terraformingimport VPCRoute53Security GroupRDSELB import import 12Terraform

Pythonk8s API ### 1\. k8sAPI serverCertificate GKEk8sGCP etcdAPI server [API server](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/access-cluster-api/) GKE[](https://qiita.com/zaru/items/bf5b4e60ad4d67be8bea) ### 2\. k8sservice accountToken [](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/) k8sservice accountGCP * ServiceAccount: * Role: * RoleBinding: Role 3 pod * ClusterRole: * ClusterRoleBinding: ClusterRole namespacenamespace [](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/rbac/) 
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: Role
metadata:
  name: my-k8s-client
  namespace: my-k8s-ns
rules:
- apiGroups: [] #  indicates the core API group
  resources: [pods, services]
  verbs: [get, list, watch, create, update, patch, delete]
- apiGroups: [extensions]
  resources: [deployments]
  verbs: [get, list, watch, create, update, patch, delete]
- apiGroups: [autoscaling]
  resources: [horizontalpodautoscalers]
  verbs: [get, list, watch, create, update, patch, delete]
---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: RoleBinding
metadata:
  name: my-k8s-client
  namespace: my-k8s-ns
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: Role
  name: my-k8s-client
subjects:
  - kind: ServiceAccount
    name: my-k8s-client
    namespace: my-k8s-ns
RoleResourceapiGroupsAPIdocumentverbs `kubectl apply` service account 
kubectl get secrets --namespace=kubectl describe secret/
service accountToken`ey~~~` ### 3\. Pythonk8s API API 
from kubernetes import client
import yaml

# init
configuration = client.Configuration()

# step2Token
configuration.api_key["authorization"] = '' configuration.api_key_prefix['authorization'] = 'Bearer' # step1API server configuration.host = 'https://' # step1API serverCertificate configuration.ssl_ca_cert = '' # api v1 = client.CoreV1Api(client.ApiClient(configuration)) # pod print(v1.list_namespaced_pod(namespace=my-k8s-ns)) # apibeta deploy_api = client.ExtensionsV1beta1Api(client.ApiClient(configuration)) # yamldeployment with open('path/to/deployment.yaml') as f: nice_dict = yaml.load(f) resp = deploy_api.create_namespaced_deployment(body=nice_dict, namespace=my-k8s-ns)
pseudo code `kubectl apply` `deploy_api.patch_namespaced_deployment` try-except Basic[](https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/blob/master/kubernetes/client/configuration.py#L84) `config.load_kube_config()` ok programatic [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48151388/kubernetes-python-client-authentication-issue)

Istio Istio[](http://techeten.xyz/10305) ## * NamespaceIstio injection * FQDNGatewayVirtualService FQDNIstio * VirtualServiceNamespaceGateway * GatewayNamespaceGatewayFQDN NamespaceNamespace (Namespace[](https://preliminary.istio.io/docs/tasks/traffic-management/secure-ingress/#configure-a-tls-ingress-gateway-for-multiple-hosts)) ## : GatewayNamespace [Google group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/istio-users/QFUcc4AV4Jk) > gateways are not namespaced -they are common across all namespaces. Gateway ([Issue](https://github.com/istio/istio/issues/6046)) Namespacekube-dns k8s 
..svc.cluster.local
VirtualService > destination > host Namespace 
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: Gateway
metadata:
 name: common-istio-gateway
spec:
 selector:
   istio: ingressgateway # use istio default controller
 servers:
 - port: #certificate(another-tls.crt)Secret
     number: 443
     name: https
     protocol: HTTPS
   tls:
     mode: SIMPLE
     serverCertificate: /etc/istio/ingressgateway-certs/tls.crt
     privateKey: /etc/istio/ingressgateway-certs/tls.key
   hosts:
   - my-app1.example.com
   - my-app2.example.com
---
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: VirtualService
metadata:
 name: my-app1
spec:
 hosts:
 - my-app1.example.com
 gateways:
 - common-istio-gateway
 http:
 - route:
   - destination:
       host:
         my-service1.my-app1.svc.cluster.local
       port:
         number: 80
---
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: VirtualService
metadata:
 name: my-app2
spec:
 hosts:
 - my-app2.example.com
 gateways:
 - common-istio-gateway
 http:
 - route:
   - destination:
       host:
         my-service2.my-app2.svc.cluster.local
       port:
         number: 80
Namespacedefault namespace ## > Also, I would suggest launching different gateway controllers for each gateway spec, instead of adding multiple gateways to the same controller (istio: ingressgateway). ControllerGateway

internal.content:
IstioGKE * GKE * Istio Istio IstioGoogle[Istio 1.0 ](https://medium.com/google-cloud-jp/istio-1-0-%E3%82%92%E8%A9%A6%E3%81%97%E3%81%A6%E3%81%BF%E3%81%9F-d74f75eeb1b1) ## * GCPglobal IPFQDN * IngressSSL termination * IngressNginxpodkube-dns * podGCS Istio namespacenamespace ## 1. 2.Istionamespace 3.namespace ## Istio `$ kubectl apply -f install/kubernetes/istio-demo.yaml` istio-demo-auth.yamlmutualTLSpodTLSreadiness probeliveness probe [portprobeport](https://github.com/istio/istio/issues/2628)Readiness Istionamespace namespaceIstio `$kubectl label namespace my-app istio-injection=enabled` namespacepod IstioEnvoysidecar kubernetes1.9kubernetespod initializer ## 1\. IstioIngress IstioIngressIstioGatewayVirtualService (0.8Ingress[](https://github.com/istio/istio/issues/1024)) IngressIstio > In a Kubernetes environment, the Kubernetes Ingress Resource is used to specify services that should be exposed outside the cluster. In an Istio service mesh, a better approach (which also works in both Kubernetes and other environments) is to use a different configuration model, namely Istio Gateway. A Gateway allows Istio features such as monitoring and route rules to be applied to traffic entering the cluster. [](https://istio.io/docs/tasks/traffic-management/ingress/#determining-the-ingress-ip-and-ports-when-using-a-node-port) GCPglobal IPIstio ServiceLoadbalancerIP > Per our chat, it is possible to set the load balancer IP in a LoadBalancer service (search for loadBalancerIP on https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/). This can be set to a regional static IP but not global static IP - this is limited in Arcus and there's no plan to support global. The missing part is that you have to use the actual IP address instead of a nice label like you can with an Ingress (kubernetes.io/ingress.global-static-ip-name: my-static-ip). [Issue](https://github.com/istio/istio/issues/3800) IngressSSLtermination 
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: my-app
  annotations:
    kubernetes.io/ingress.global-static-ip-name: "gad-my-app" # 
    kubernetes.io/ingress.allow-http: "false"
    ingress.gcp.kubernetes.io/pre-shared-cert: "myapp-cert"#
IngressIPblue-greenGKE ### Regional IPIstioServiceLoadBalancerIPpatch k8sServiceLoadBalancerIPIPServiceIP Istioistio-systemnamespaceistio-ingressgatewayk8sService IstioIPIPistio-ingressgateway > $ kubectl patch svc istio-ingressgateway --namespace istio-system \ --patch '{"spec": { "loadBalancerIP": "" }' [KnativeReadme](https://github.com/knative/docs/blob/master/serving/gke-assigning-static-ip-address.md) IPIstioLB ### SSLterminationsecret IngressterminationGateway secret 
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: istio-ingressgateway-certs # 
  namespace: istio-system
type: Opaque
data:
  tls.key: my-key-base64
  tls.crt: my-crt-base64
IstionamespaceGateway Gateway `$ kubectl apply -f gateway.yaml` 
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: Gateway
metadata:
  name: my-gateway
  namespace: my-app
spec:
  selector:
    istio: ingressgateway # use istio default controller
  servers:
  - port:
      number: 443
      name: https
      protocol: HTTPS
    tls:
      mode: SIMPLE
      serverCertificate: /etc/istio/ingressgateway-certs/tls.crt # 
      privateKey: /etc/istio/ingressgateway-certs/tls.key # 
    hosts:
    - dev.my-app.com
[](https://istio.io/docs/tasks/traffic-management/secure-ingress/#configure-a-tls-ingress-gateway) GatewayVirtualService 
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: VirtualService
metadata:
  name: my-virtualservice
  namespace: my-app
spec:
  hosts:
  - dev.my-app.com
  gateways:
  - my-gateway
  http:
  - route:
    - destination:
        host:
         my-nginx # my-nginxk8s Service
        port:
          number: 80
## 2\. IstioHTTP/1.0 1.0Nginxproxy_pass1.0 1.0NginxStatus426 [Issue](https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/2506) IstioQuickstart > Note: The application must use HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/2.0 protocol for all its HTTP traffic because HTTP/1.0 is not supported. Nginx ```text proxy_http_version 1.1; ``` kube-dns `proxy_pass http://..svc.cluster.local` [](https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/master/samples/bookinfo/src/productpage/productpage.py#L54) ## 3\. APIHostname Istio `pip install``pypi.org`google api`www.googleapi.com` [](https://istio.io/blog/2018/egress-https/) Google Cloud Storage API 
https://storage.googleapi.com
http://metadata.google.internal
metadata.google.internalIPcloud storage api [Issue](https://github.com/istio/istio/issues/5288) IPA record GKEVMdefault credentials > 503 Failed to retrieve http://metadata.google.internal/computeMetadata/v1/instance/service-accounts/default/?recursive=true FQDN `kubectl apply -f external.yaml` 
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: ServiceEntry # Egress
metadata:
  name: external-google-api
  namespace: my-app
spec:
  hosts:
  - "*.googleapis.com" # wildcard
  - 169.254.169.254 # metadata.google.internalIP
  - "metadata.google.internal" # 
  location: MESH_EXTERNAL
  ports:
  - number: 443
    name: https
    protocol: HTTPS
  - number: 80
    name: http
    protocol: HTTP
---
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: VirtualService # ServiceEntryIngress
metadata:
  name: gcs-tls
  namespace: my-app
spec:
  hosts:
  - "*.googleapis.com"
  tls:
  - match: # hostsni_hostsdestination
    - port: 443
      sni_hosts:
      - "storage.googleapis.com"
    route:
    - destination:
        host: "storage.googleapis.com"
---
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3
kind: VirtualService
metadata:
  name: metadata-http
  namespace: my-app
spec:
  hosts:
  - "metadata.google.internal"
  http: # http
  - route:
    - destination:
        host: "metadata.google.internal"
        port:
          number: 80
Istio

internal.content:
This is a demo site of the [HeroBlog](https://github.com/greglobinski/gatsby-starter-hero-blog), a [GatsbyJS](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/) starter.

### Features:

* Easy editable content in **Markdown** files (posts, pages and parts)
* **CSS** with `styled-jsx` and `PostCSS`
* **SEO** (sitemap generation, robot.txt, meta and OpenGraph Tags)
* **Social** sharing (Twitter, Facebook, Google, LinkedIn)
* **Comments** (Facebook)
* **Images** lazy loading and `webp` support (gatsby-image)
* Post **categories** (category based post list)
* Full text **searching** (Algolia)
* **Contact** form (Netlify form handling)
* **RSS** feed
* 100% **PWA** (manifest.webmanifest, offline support, favicons)
* Google **Analytics**
* App **favicons** generator (node script)
* Easy customizable base **styles** via `theme` object generated from `yaml` file (fonts, colors, sizes)
* React **v.16** (gatsby-plugin-react-next)
* **Components** lazy loading (social sharing)
* **ESLint** (google config)
* **Prettier** code styling
* Webpack `BundleAnalyzerPlugin`

### Features:

Peter CorkeRobotic Toolbox

## Robotics Toolbox




### 

[Robotics Toolbox ](http://petercorke.com/Robotics_Toolbox.html)
"Downloading Toolbox""here"

[![Robot](http://techeten.xyz/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Robot-300x137.png)](http://techeten.xyz/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Robot.png)

zip"rvctools" Matlab
Matlab
rvctools > startup_rvs.m 

### 

DH
SerialLinkLink


[matlab]
function robot = generate3DoF()

% robot length values, mass, diameter
len = [0 50 50];%(-1)0
mass = 1.0;%
dia = 2.0; % 

% inertia matrix: 
Ixx = (dia^2 / 4 + len.^2 /12 ) * mass;
Iyy = Ixx;
Izz = mass * dia^2 / 2;
% []
jointFix = [-1.5 1.5];

%% Link params
L(1) = Revolute('m', mass, 'I', [Ixx(1), Iyy(1), Izz],'r',[0,0,len(1)/2], 'qlim',jointFix,'alpha', pi/2, 'a', len(1), 'd', 0);
L(2) = Revolute('m', mass, 'I', [Ixx(2), Iyy(2), Izz],'r',[0,0,len(2)/2],'qlim',[],'alpha', 0, 'a', len(2), 'd', 0);
L(3) = Revolute('m', mass, 'I', [Ixx(3), Iyy(3), Izz],'r',[0,0,len(3)/2],'qlim',[],'alpha', -pi/2, 'a', len(3), 'd', 0);

% build a serial link manipulator

robot = SerialLink(L, 'name', '3DoF');
[/matlab]


[matlab]
robot = generate3DoF();
robot.plot([0 0 0]);% 
[/matlab]



[![3DoF](http://techeten.xyz/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/3DoF-300x251.png)](http://techeten.xyz/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/3DoF.png)

OK

### 

Link
Revoluteprismatic
r:
a,alpha,d: DHthetaplot
robot.plot:figureplotscatter3fig



(ex: mdl_baxter,mdl_nao)

rvctools > robots > robot.pdf
